meanings.definition: To seek favor by flattering or ingratiating oneself.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to brownnose the boss for a promotion.
meanings.sent2: He tends to brownnose his way into getting what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The employee decided to brownnose the manager by complimenting his tie.
meanings.sent4: The student brownnosed the teacher to get a better grade on the test.
meanings.sent5: In order to brownnose the celebrity, she constantly praised his acting skills.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks favor by flattering or ingratiating themselves.
meanings.sent1: The brownnose in the office always agrees with the boss.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the biggest brownnose in the company.
meanings.sent3: The brownnose at the party kept complimenting everyone's outfits.
meanings.sent4: He was labeled as a brownnose for always trying to please the higher-ups.
meanings.sent5: The brownnose in the group was constantly seeking approval from others.
